intro: Cynanchum longicoronatum, commonly known as the long冠 milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by follicles containing seeds. It is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, and it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
